<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 194, 220, 208]]<|/det|>
# MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 215, 356, 232]]<|/det|>
Paper 2 Pure Mathematics 2 (P2)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 259, 460, 303]]<|/det|>
Additional Materials: Answer Booklet/Paper Graph Paper List of Formulae (MF9)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[760, 195, 907, 210]]<|/det|>
9709/23  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[784, 217, 907, 233]]<|/det|>
May/June 2011  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[760, 239, 907, 254]]<|/det|>
1 hour 15 minutes  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 320, 390, 338]]<|/det|>
## READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 351, 828, 367]]<|/det|>
If you have been given an Answer Booklet, follow the instructions on the front cover of the Booklet.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 368, 722, 384]]<|/det|>
Write your Centre number, candidate number and name on all the work you hand in.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 384, 327, 400]]<|/det|>
Write in dark blue or black pen.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 400, 497, 416]]<|/det|>
You may use a soft pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 416, 601, 433]]<|/det|>
Do not use staples, paper clips, highlighters, glue or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 447, 284, 463]]<|/det|>
Answer all the questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 463, 907, 494]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place in the case of angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 494, 590, 510]]<|/det|>
The use of an electronic calculator is expected, where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 510, 606, 526]]<|/det|>
You are reminded of the need for clear presentation in your answers.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 540, 606, 556]]<|/det|>
At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 556, 756, 572]]<|/det|>
The number of marks is given in brackets [ ] at the end of each question or part question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 572, 440, 588]]<|/det|>
The total number of marks for this paper is 50.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 588, 907, 619]]<|/det|>
Questions carrying smaller numbers of marks are printed earlier in the paper, and questions carrying larger numbers of marks later in the paper.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 97, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 72, 897, 92]]<|/det|>
Use logarithms to solve the equation \(3^{x} = 2^{x + 2}\), giving your answer correct to 3 significant figures.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 87, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 135, 92, 154]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[331, 141, 700, 365]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 384, 920, 420]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows the curve \(y = \sqrt{(1 + x^3)}\). Region \(A\) is bounded by the curve and the lines \(x = 0\), \(x = 2\) and \(y = 0\). Region \(B\) is bounded by the curve and the lines \(x = 0\) and \(y = 3\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[126, 432, 153, 450]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 431, 920, 465]]<|/det|>
Use the trapezium rule with two intervals to find an approximation to the area of region \(A\). Give your answer correct to 2 decimal places.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 448, 920, 467]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 478, 153, 496]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 477, 920, 511]]<|/det|>
Deduce an approximation to the area of region \(B\) and explain why this approximation underestimates the true area of region \(B\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 495, 920, 512]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 540, 96, 559]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 540, 435, 559]]<|/det|>
The sequence \(x_{1}, x_{2}, x_{3}, \ldots\) defined by

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[386, 566, 609, 588]]<|/det|>
\[x_{1} = 1,\quad x_{n + 1} = \textstyle \frac{1}{2}\sqrt[3]{(x_{n}^{2} + 6)}\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 594, 320, 612]]<|/det|>
converges to the value \(\alpha\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 625, 151, 644]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 625, 920, 658]]<|/det|>
Find the value of \(\alpha\) correct to 3 decimal places. Show your working, giving each calculated value of the sequence to 5 decimal places.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 662, 920, 681]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 670, 153, 689]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 670, 705, 689]]<|/det|>
Find, in the form \(ax^{3} + bx^{2} + c = 0\), an equation of which \(\alpha\) is a root.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 670, 920, 689]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 727, 94, 746]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 725, 144, 744]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 720, 420, 756]]<|/det|>
Find the value of \(\int_{0}^{\frac{2}{3}\pi} \sin \left(\frac{1}{2} x\right) \mathrm{d}x\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 728, 920, 747]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 771, 146, 791]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 770, 332, 795]]<|/det|>
Find \(\int \mathrm{e}^{-x}(1 + \mathrm{e}^{x}) \mathrm{d}x\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 777, 920, 794]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 831, 94, 850]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 831, 920, 865]]<|/det|>
A curve has equation \(x^{2} + 2y^{2} + 5x + 6y = 10\). Find the equation of the tangent to the curve at the point (2, \(-1\)). Give your answer in the form \(ax + by + c = 0\), where \(a\), \(b\) and \(c\) are integers.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 848, 920, 866]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 97, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 73, 494, 92]]<|/det|>
The curve \(y = 4x^{2}\ln x\) has one stationary point.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[126, 103, 153, 122]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 103, 900, 123]]<|/det|>
Find the coordinates of this stationary point, giving your answers correct to 3 decimal places.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 120, 917, 139]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 150, 153, 168]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 150, 680, 168]]<|/det|>
Determine whether this point is a maximum or a minimum point.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 151, 917, 170]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 197, 97, 216]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 197, 443, 216]]<|/det|>
The cubic polynomial \(\mathrm{p}(x)\) is defined by

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[390, 223, 608, 243]]<|/det|>
\[\mathrm{p}(x) = 6x^{3} + ax^{2} + bx + 10,\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 250, 920, 284]]<|/det|>
where \(a\) and \(b\) are constants. It is given that \((x + 2)\) is a factor of \(\mathrm{p}(x)\) and that, when \(\mathrm{p}(x)\) is divided by \((x + 1)\), the remainder is 24.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 297, 156, 316]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 297, 373, 316]]<|/det|>
Find the values of \(a\) and \(b\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 298, 918, 316]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 327, 153, 346]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 327, 630, 346]]<|/det|>
When \(a\) and \(b\) have these values, factorise \(\mathrm{p}(x)\) completely.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 327, 920, 346]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 373, 96, 392]]<|/det|>
<label>8</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 374, 153, 393]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 374, 534, 393]]<|/det|>
Prove that \(\sin^{2}2\theta (\cos \mathrm{e}\mathrm{c}^{2}\theta - \sec^{2}\theta)\equiv 4\cos 2\theta .\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 375, 920, 393]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 405, 161, 424]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 405, 215, 424]]<|/det|>
Hence

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 431, 175, 448]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[185, 431, 724, 448]]<|/det|>
solve for \(0^{\circ}\leqslant \theta \leqslant 180^{\circ}\) the equation \(\sin^{2}2\theta (\cos \mathrm{e}\mathrm{c}^{2}\theta - \sec^{2}\theta) = 3,\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 431, 918, 448]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 456, 185, 475]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[196, 456, 549, 475]]<|/det|>
find the exact value of \(\cos \mathrm{e}\mathrm{c}^{2}15^{\circ} - \sec^{2}15^{\circ}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 456, 918, 475]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]
